Entree.Name: House Specialty
Entree.Description: Pan seared chicken supreme with a sun-dried tomato pistachio pesto cream sauce, served with roasted potatoes and seasonal vegetables
Braised jumbo sea scallops on a sun-dried roast tomato base
Free-range chicken breast stuffed with morels in a brandy sauce

Entree.Name: Eggplant Pamigiana
Entree.Description: Fresh eggplant, thinly sliced and breaded, topped with tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese, baked golden brown. Served with linguine in tomato sauce
Roast pork loin on a bed of garlic ginger apple slaw

Restaurant.Name: Gong’s Asian Cuisine
Restaurant.Summary: The food is always consistent. A good variety of dim sum, sushi, Chinese and even Vietnamese dishes. The service is quick and the food is plentiful. We sat down last night and within seconds of turning in our first order, the plates were on the table! The teriyaki dishes had the right amount of sauce and weren't sickeningly sweet. The chicken, fish, and beef were perfectly cooked. The makirolls were neatly rolled, cut properly and seasoned well. Loved the General Tao chicken, the steamed BBQ pork buns, the eel sushi and the lovely eggplant. We will be going back again! I would highly recommend it

Entree.Name: Sweet and Sour Fish Cantonese Style

Restaurant.Name: Baker Street TexMex Grill
Restaurant.Summary: My favorite restaurant in Ottawa. The family who owns it are very warm and lovely people. They are incredible at recognizing you when you come back. The burritos are super good. You can customize however you want (guac is included!). I especially love that there is cactus in the veggie mix; it is a small, special thing that sets this place apart from other Mexican spots downtown.
